requirements: write the code to implement binary search

test_cases.name: T1_Functional_Middle
test_cases.description: Search for an element in the middle of the array (Target 23, Expected Index 5).

test_cases.name: T2_Edge_Start
test_cases.description: Search for the first element (Target 2, Expected Index 0).

test_cases.name: T3_Edge_End
test_cases.description: Search for the last element (Target 91, Expected Index 9).

test_cases.name: T4_Functional_NotFound_Internal
test_cases.description: Search for an element not present, but within the range (Target 40, Expected -1).

test_cases.name: T5_Edge_NotFound_Above
test_cases.description: Search for an element greater than the max value (Target 100, Expected -1).

test_cases.name: T6_Edge_NotFound_Below
test_cases.description: Search for an element less than the min value (Target 1, Expected -1).

test_cases.name: T7_Edge_EmptyArray
test_cases.description: Test search on an empty array (Expected -1). Verified input validation message.

test_cases.name: T8_Edge_NullArray
test_cases.description: Test search on a null array input (Expected -1). Verified input validation logic.

test_cases.name: T9_Edge_SingleElement_Found
test_cases.description: Test search on a single-element array (Target 5, Expected 0).

test_cases.name: T10_Edge_SingleElement_NotFound
test_cases.description: Test search on a single-element array where target is missing (Target 10, Expected -1).

test_cases.name: T11_Edge_TwoElements_Low
test_cases.description: Test search on a two-element array (Target 10, Expected 0).

test_cases.name: T12_Edge_TwoElements_High
test_cases.description: Test search on a two-element array (Target 20, Expected 1).

test_cases.name: T13_Edge_TwoElements_NotFound
test_cases.description: Test search on a two-element array where target is missing (Target 15, Expected -1).

test_cases.name: T14_Functional_Duplicates
test_cases.description: Test search on an array containing duplicate values (Target 5, Expected any valid index).

recommendations: The implementation is excellent. It correctly uses the safe midpoint calculation (`low + (high - low) / 2`) to prevent potential integer overflow, which is a common bug in binary search implementations dealing with extremely large arrays.
Consider adding Javadoc documentation to the `binarySearch` method explicitly stating the requirement that the input `array` must be sorted for the algorithm to function correctly.
